#Text=Interview with Innocent Watat , City Council candidate for Wards 3 & 4 in Brampton , Canada
#Text=Saturday , October 21 , 2006
#Text=The upcoming 2006 Brampton municipal election , to be held November 13 , features an array of candidates looking to represent their wards in city council or the council of the Peel Region .
#Text=Wikinews contributor Nick Moreau contacted many of the candidates , including
#Text=Innocent Watat
#Text=, asking them to answer common questions sent in an email .
#Text=This ward 's incumbent is Bob Callahan ; Balbir Babra , Manny Bianchi-Morfino , Dolly Khokhar , Maria Peart , Tim Turcott , and Sheila White .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Q :
#Text=List the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :
#Text=- Gap between council actions and concerns of Bramptonians .
#Text=-
#Text=Community safety and security and relationship between Police and the community mostly the relationship between the Police and the visible minorities ' community
#Text=- Infrastructure and public transit concerns
#Text=Q :
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A :
#Text=My ward is overwhelmingly and increasingly populated by a multi-ethnic and multi cultural immigrants from around the world .

#Text=Beside the infrequent public transit issues which are the main concern for these settlers , I think that the most relevant issue here is safety because of the stigma leading to discriminatory profile from Police .
#Text=Of course these newcomers in the city are not today part of the main discussions at the council chamber although they are significantly part of the future of the city .
#Text=Q :
#Text=What qualities or experiences do you possess , that make you more desirable than the incumbent ?
#Text=A :
#Text=I am a young , dynamic , dedicated and passionate Bramptonian willing to push this great city to a deserved place as a Canadian model of multi-cultural and multi ethnicity integration .
#Text=I would use my positive energy and the new vision to develop our community by making it safer , cleaner , lively , exotic and vibrant .
#Text=I am resolved to turn into my obligations all the concerns of the people of Brampton .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why do you want to represent your ward on council ?
#Text=A :
#Text=I strongly feel that I could bring something new to my wards and to the council chamber .

#Text=I also think it is time for change ; it is the time to see some new faces and to have a council that strictly reflects the reality of the population , a chamber that really works for the benefit of the population .
#Text=I am an advocate of a maximum of three terms by councilor and I still cannot believe that we do have councilors who are there for more than 15 years now .
#Text=There is no doubt that issues of the 1980s or the 1990s are well out of date .
#Text=There are new realities on the field today , and I am bringing that vision with me .
#Text=This vision is beyond what the incumbent of ward 3 , 4 has to offer .
#Text=He has done his time , if he really loves our city , he needs to give the chance to fresh mind to continue what he has started while he can calmly enjoy a deserved retirement .
